isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - Meritor Transfer Cases MTC-4208, -4210, and -4213 - Assembly - Front Input Shaft, Input Shaft Bearing Cage and Oil Pump Assembly

svcproc.title: Front Input Shaft, Input Shaft Bearing Cage and Oil Pump Assembly

step1.para: Place the large O-ring around the groove on the bearing cage (Figure 57).
Pack grease into the pump oil inlet port before assembling the oil pump to the input bearing cage (Figure 58).
Place the bearing cone on the race in the bearing cage.

Insert the relief valve and spring into the relief port of the input bearing cage. Install the large diameter end of the spring down (Figure 57). Align the oil pump inlet with the oil inlet port of the input bearing cage (Figure 58).
Install the six pump-to-inlet bearing cage capscrews and washers. Apply Loctite® 277 sealant to the capscrews. Tighten the capscrews to 35-50 lb-ft (48-68 Nm).
Place the small helical gear over the input shaft and install the spiral snap ring (Figure 28).
Lubricate the gear and shaft before assembly.
Place the oil pump and input bearing cage assembly over the input shaft. The drive teeth on the inner pump rotor must engage the teeth on the input shaft. Do not use force to engage the splines.
Replace the front input shaft bearing cage oil seal. Use oil seal driver R4422402 (Meritor Kit No. 4454) to correctly install the seal (Figure 59).
Install the yoke, washer and yoke nut. Loosely tighten the yoke nut at this time.
